alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Henry; Shelby (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 5:47PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Shelby, Henry and northwestern Franklin Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 547 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near New Castle, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Shelby, Henry and northwestern Franklin Counties, including the following locations... North Pleasureville, Drennon Springs, Delville, Bethlehem, Slabtown, Elmburg, Polsgrove, Orville, Pleasureville and Flag Fork. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
